title: Zoom, Best Buy, Urban Outfitters: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Zoom Video's sales slowed last quarter; Dell, HP and VMware are due to report earnings
text:
* Best Buy posted lackluster sales growth heading into the holiday season, pushing shares down about 11%. The firm was one of the few large chains unable to capitalize on high consumer demand for electronics and other goods.

* Urban Outfitters shares tumbled 11% after the clothing company said in-store sales fell in the third quarter.

* Dick's Sporting Goods logged slower online growth as more people returned to stores. Shares slipped 2.2%.

* Dollar Tree's third-quarter earnings and sales results were in line with analysts' expectations. Shares fell 1.7%. Activist investor Mantle Ridge has a stake of at least $1.8 billion in the discount retailer and plans to push it to take action to boost its share price, The Wall Street Journal reported this month.

* Dell Technologies, HP and VMware are among the companies reporting earnings after the close.

* Royalty Pharma rose 0.5% after the buyer of biopharmaceutical royalties said it had bought additional royalty interests in BCX9930 and Orladeyo from BioCryst Pharmaceuticals.

* Farfetch gained 4.9% after Guggenheim analysts recommended buying shares of the fashion retailer.

* J.M. Smucker raised its forecast for earnings in fiscal 2022, boosting shares 2.8% premarket.

* Agilent Technologies slipped 5.4% even though the maker of laboratory equipment posted higher profit in its fourth quarter.

* Goldman Sachs analysts recommended selling shares of Allstate, sending the insurer down 1.9%.

* VTB Capital analysts recommended buying shares of EPAM Systems, boosting the software company 1.9% premarket.

* Aptiv lost 1%. Analysts at Barclays, Raymond James and Credit Suisse have raised their stock price target for the maker of auto parts this month.

Write to Joe Wallace at joe.wallace@wsj.com

Zoom, Best Buy, Urban Outfitters: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
